description:
IC 2220 Toby Jug Nebula, GN 07.55.9, AGN 07.54.2; Carina
Astro-Physics 155 EDF (155TCC) f/5.4 refractor
KAF-16803 FLI Proline
Total Exposure Time: 8+ hours, LRGB 140:120:100:140 minutes unbinned
April-May 2010; RDO, Moorook, AU

Comments: The bright yellow reflection nebula right of center has been called the Toby Jug Nebula. This image shows the expansive cloud of interstellar dust from which it is created.

 In examining the nebula IC 2220, Astronomers Paul Murdin, David Allen and astrophotographer David Malin coined the name "Toby Jug Nebula" for the object because of its shape as tankard of a type called Toby Jug. Another name given to this object is the Butterfly Nebula, owing to the similarity in appearance as a butterfly in flight.
title: IC2220 (Toby Jug Nebula) region, GN 07.55.9, AGN 07.54.2; Carina
